MPC

Class IntMap<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • MPC.IntMap<E>

  • public class IntMap<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    This is essentially a variant of HashMap for our purposes: (1) We want to be able to look up based on an int, thus avoid making unnecessary objects; (2) Since we are implementing this ourselves, we implement only the functionality we need.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  IntMap.IntMapEntry<E>
      Nested, but not inner, class for entries in the map; we will have buckets that start chains of these entries that have the same hash code for their key

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int defaultChains
      constant for the default number of chains 53 is prime (good), but otherwise arbitrary
      private IntMap.IntMapEntry[] hashChains
      array that roots the hash chains of IntMapEntry objects

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntMap()
      constructor that builds a map with the default number of hash chains
      IntMap(int chains)
      constructor that builds a map with the specified number of hash chains

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      method for removing all entries from the map
      E get(int i)
      looks up a value given its int key; returns null if the the key is not in the table
      private int getHash(int hash)
      private methods to compute the index of a hash chain given hash code int key value
      void put(int i, E value)
      method for adding a key/value pair to the map; it ASSUMES the key is not already present!
      void remove(int i)
      method to remove from the table a specific key and its associated value

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntMap

        constructor that builds a map with the default number of hash chains

      • IntMap

        public IntMap(int chains)
        constructor that builds a map with the specified number of hash chains
        Parameters:
        chains - an int giving the number of hash chains (buckets) to use

    • Method Detail

      • getHash

        private int getHash(int hash)
        private methods to compute the index of a hash chain given hash code int key value
        Parameters:
        hash - the hash code value to reduce modulo the table size
        Returns:
        the hash chain index to use

      • get

        public E get(int i)
        looks up a value given its int key; returns null if the the key is not in the table
        Parameters:
        i - the int key to look up
        Returns:
        the associated Object, or null if there is none

      • put

        public void put(int i,
                E value)
        method for adding a key/value pair to the map; it ASSUMES the key is not already present!
        Parameters:
        i - the key for this new map entry
        value - the Object value for this new map entry

      • remove

        public void remove(int i)
        method to remove from the table a specific key and its associated value
        Parameters:
        i - a key to remove

      • clear

        public void clear()
        method for removing all entries from the map
